net.wimpi.modbus.facade
Class ModbusTCPMaster

java.lang.Object
  net.wimpi.modbus.facade.ModbusTCPMaster
public class ModbusTCPMaster
extends java.lang.Object

Modbus/TCP Master facade.

Version:
1.1 (08/06/2004)
Author:
Dieter Wimberger

Constructor Summary
ModbusTCPMaster(java.lang.String addr)
          Constructs a new master facade instance for communication with a given slave.

          Constructs a new master facade instance for communication with a given slave.

Constructor Detail

ModbusTCPMaster

public ModbusTCPMaster(java.lang.String addr)
Constructs a new master facade instance for communication with a given slave.

Parameters:
addr - an internet address as resolvable IP name or IP number, specifying the slave to communicate with.

ModbusTCPMaster

public ModbusTCPMaster(java.lang.String addr,
                       int port)
Constructs a new master facade instance for communication with a given slave.

Parameters:
addr - an internet address as resolvable IP name or IP number, specifying the slave to communicate with.
port - the port the slave is listening to.
Method Detail

connect

public void connect()
             throws java.lang.Exception
Connects this ModbusTCPMaster with the slave.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the connection cannot be established.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnects this ModbusTCPMaster from the slave.

setReconnecting

public void setReconnecting(boolean b)
Sets the flag that specifies whether to maintain a constant connection or reconnect for every transaction.

Parameters:
b - true if a new connection should be established for each transaction, false otherwise.

isReconnecting

public boolean isReconnecting()
Tests if a constant connection is maintained or if a new connection is established for every transaction.

Returns:
true if a new connection should be established for each transaction, false otherwise.

readCoils

public int readCoils(int ref,
                     int count,
                     BitVector coils)
              throws ModbusException
Reads a given number of coil states from the slave.

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the coil to start reading from.
count - (IN) the number of coil states to be read.
coils - (OUT) a BitVector which will be used to return the received coil states.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.

writeCoil

public int writeCoil(int ref,
                     boolean state)
              throws ModbusException
Writes a coil state to the slave.

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the coil to be written.
state - (IN) the coil state to be written.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.

writeMultipleCoils

public int writeMultipleCoils(int ref,
                              int count,
                              BitVector coils)
                       throws ModbusException
Writes a given number of coil states to the slave.

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the coil to start writing to.
count - (IN) the number of coil states to be written.
coils - (IN) a BitVector which holds the coil states to be written.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.

readInputDiscretes

public int readInputDiscretes(int ref,
                              int count,
                              BitVector indisc)
                       throws ModbusException
Reads a given number of input discrete states from the slave.

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the input discrete to start reading from.
count - (IN) the number of input discrete states to be read.
indisc - (OUT) a BitVector which will be used to return the received input discrete states.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.

readInputRegisters

public int readInputRegisters(int ref,
                              int count,
                              SimpleInputRegister[] registers)
                       throws ModbusException
Reads a given number of input registers from the slave.

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the input register to start reading from.
count - (IN) the number of input registers to be read.
registers - (OUT) a SimpleInputRegister[] which will be used to return the received input register values.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.

readMultipleRegisters

public int readMultipleRegisters(int ref,
                                 int count,
                                 SimpleRegister[] registers)
                          throws ModbusException
Reads a given number of registers from the slave.

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the register to start reading from.
count - (IN) the number of registers to be read.
registers - (OUT) a SimpleRegister[] which will be used to return the received register values.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.

writeSingleRegister

public int writeSingleRegister(int ref,
                               SimpleRegister register)
                        throws ModbusException
Writes a register to the slave.

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the register to be written.
register - (IN) a SimpleRegister holding the value of the register to be written.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.

writeMultipleRegisters

                                  SimpleRegister[] registers)
                           throws ModbusException

Parameters:
ref - (IN) the offset of the register to start writing to.
registers - (IN) a SimpleRegister[] holding the values of the registers to be written.
Returns:
0 if the slave responded correctly, the code of the slave exception otherwise.
Throws:
ModbusException - if the command transaction fails.
